newsitem.title: USA: Republic National ups prime rate to 8.50. [CORRECTED 23:10 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Republic National ups prime rate to 8.50. [CORRECTED 23:10 GMT]

text.p: Republic National Bank of New York raised its prime lending rate to 8.50 percent from 8.25 percent effective March 25 (corrects date from March 26), the bank said on Tuesday.
The move follows a decision by the Federal Reserve to raise the federal funds rate by 25 basis points and to leave the discount unchanged.

Tuesday's prime rate hikes mark the first time banks have ratcheted up their lending rates in over two years. The Fed last altered monetary policy on January 31, 1996, when it lowered both the federal funds rate and the discount rate by 25 basis points.
